prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Athena Cykes
Description: A new lawyer at the agency. She's been arrested as the suspect in the case.
Character 1
Name: Apollo Justice
Description: Currently working on his own. He says he wants to bring his friend's killer to justice, but I wonder if that's all.
Character 2
Name: Trucy Wright
Description: My daughter, who also happens to be an aspiring magician. I adopted her eight years ago.
Character 3
Name: Clay Terran
Description: The victim in this case. He was a HAT-2 crew member and a close friend of Apollo's.
Character 4
Name: Juniper Woods
Description: Athena's childhood friend. I defended her when she was on trial for the courtroom bombing incident.
Character 5
Name: Solomon Starbuck
Description: The defendant in this case.[1] He was a HAT-2 crew member and a mentor to the victim.
Character 6
Name: Simon Blackquill
Description: Convicted of the murder at the Space Center seven years ago. He's chasing a phantom he saw back then.
Character 7
Name: Bobby Fulbright
Description: The detective assigned to this case. He led the evacuation effort at the Space Center after the bombing incident.
Character 8
Name: Candice Arme
Description: A detective who specialized in bomb cases. Was on detail at the Space Center. One of the first to find the body.
Character 9
Name: Yuri Cosmos
Description: The director of the Space Center and one of the first people to discover the body. He seems exceedingly full of himself.
Character 10
Name: Ponco
Description: A guide robot at the Space Center. She can provide information on the Center and show people around.
Character 11
Name: Aura Blackquill
Description: A researcher who's developing robots at the Space Center. She is Prosecutor Blackquill's older sister.
Character 12
Name: Clonco
Description: One of the robots developed by Aura, who refers to him as "Hunk of Junk".
Character 13
Name: Metis Cykes
Description: Athena's mother and victim of the murder seven years ago. She was a talented psychologist like her daughter.
Character 14
Name: Pearl Fey
Description: A spirit medium in training. Her psychic powers are beyond question.
Character 15
Name: Miles Edgeworth
Description: The chief prosecutor. He's an old friend and a former prosecutor against whom I fought many courtroom battles.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: It's my all-important badge. Proof of my profession.
Evidence 1
Name: Space Center Diagram
Description: A cross-section view of the main building of the Space Center and Launch Pad 1.
Evidence 2
Name: Utility Knife
Description: It has the victim's blood on it. From a set of utility tools used by Space Center techs. The murder weapon in this case. Athena also used one of these to stab the phantom's hand during the incident seven years ago.
Evidence 3
Name: Space Center Pamphlet
Description: It includes a diagram of the boarding lounge and a cross-section view of the Space Center. (3 pages.)
Evidence 4
Name: "Hope" Capsule
Description: Found in the victim's possession. It recently returned from a seven-year mission and contains asteroid samples. It was at the crime scene seven years ago. It was launched into space and only returned to Earth a few days ago.
Evidence 5
Name: HAT-1 Exhibit
Description: A newspaper clipping, a photo of the people involved with the launch, and a jacket one of them wore. A newspaper clipping, a photo of the people involved with the launch, and the jacket worn by Dr. Cykes.
Evidence 6
Name: Katana
Description: The weapon used in the murder seven years ago. It belonged to the victim. The victim's blood was found only on the blade.
Evidence 7
Name: Seven-Year-Old Video
Description: Video showing the corridor to the crime scene. Blackquill was the only one to pass through at the time of the crime.
Evidence 8
Name: Photo of the Crime
Description: Taken inadvertently. It became conclusive evidence at Simon Blackquill's trial seven years ago. The photo shows Blackquill taking the robot apart. There's a bloodstain at the end of the robot's arm.
Evidence 9
Name: Seven-Year-Old Photos
Description: Two photos of the body and crime scene. They were taken by the first person to discover the body. [caption] The victim is lying on the operating table. On the other side of the room is a workbench. The victim's clothes are drenched in blood.
Evidence 10
Name: Metis's Autopsy Report
Description: The cause of death was a stab wound to the chest. The weapon pierced the heart and so death was instantaneous.
Evidence 11
Name: Robots with a Heart
Description: It explains the recognition and communication features of the Ponco series of Robots.
Evidence 12
Name: Moon Rock Earring
Description: An earring that Dr. Cykes gave to Athena. The stone was cut from a real moon rock that was being used for research.
Evidence 13
Name: Phantom's Psych Profile
Description: The subject's emotions rarely fluctuate and he doesn't experience feelings like normal people do.
Evidence 14
Name: Terran's Autopsy Report
Description: Cause of death: Stabbing. The victim was discovered in the third-floor boarding lounge in the main building.
Evidence 15
Name: Security Camera Video
Description: Video showing the defendant and victim's escape from the corridor. The video ends immediately after this scene.
Evidence 16
Name: Launch Pad 1 Door Lock
Description: Starbuck's prints were found on this door lock. Also see photo taken after the incident. (2 pages.) The biometric door lock. Print authentication isn't required from the launch pad side. (2 pages.)
Evidence 17
Name: Aura's Statement
Description: The perp held a lighter with an Earth emblem on it in their left hand, and a knife in their right.
Evidence 18
Name: Lighter
Description: Evidence found by Detective Fulbright. It has Athena's prints on it in the victim's blood. A lighter that can transform into a handgun. It has Clay Terran's fingerprints and blood on it.
Evidence 19
Name: Emergency Ladder
Description: It was lowered to the ground from the window of the fourth-floor robotics lab. It was used to evacuate Space Center personnel.
Evidence 20
Name: Phony Phanty Bomb
Description: It was found in Boarding Lounge 1 and detonated in Courtroom No. 4. Fragments are being analyzed. (2 pages.)

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: I went to the robotics lab at about 2 PM for my regular recharge!
Person: Ponco
Testimony 1
Testimony: Just as I was about to charge up, Athena came in and hugged Mommy Metis!
Person: Ponco
Testimony 2
Testimony: And then Mommy Metis fell down. After that, I was recharging, so I don't know anything.
Person: Ponco
Testimony 3
Testimony: Mommy Metis fell down near the round window on the workbench side of the room!
Person: Ponco
Testimony 4
Testimony: After I charged up, I was cleaning the room, and Mr. Simon came in.
Person: Ponco
Testimony 5
Testimony: And then an error occurred. There is no data after that point.
Person: Ponco

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let's try to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other. So, first, I need to look through all the testimonies and see if any of them don't line up with the evidence provided.

Looking at the testimonies, Ponco is the one giving all of them. Testimony 0 says she went to the robotics lab around 2 PM for her regular recharge. Testimony 1 mentions Athena coming in and hugging Mommy Metis (who is Metis Cykes, Athena's mother). Then Testimony 2 states that after that, Ponco was recharging and doesn't know anything else. Testimony 3 adds that Mommy Metis fell near the round window on the workbench side. Testimony 4 says after charging, Ponco was cleaning and Simon came in. Testimony 5 notes an error with no data after.

Now, looking at the evidence. Let's check each one. Evidence 7 is the seven-year-old video showing the corridor, with Blackquill being the only one there at the crime time. Evidence 8 is the photo of Blackquill taking the robot apart with a bloodstain on the robot's arm. Evidence 10 is Metis's autopsy report, which says she was stabbed in the chest, death was instant. Evidence 13 is the Phantom's profile, which mentions emotions don't fluctuate. 

Wait, the key contradiction here is about the murder of Metis seven years ago. According to Ponco's testimonies (Testimony 1 and 3), she saw Athena hugging Metis, then Metis fell down near the window. But the evidence related to the seven-year-old case (like Evidence 7 and 8) implicates Simon Blackquill. The video (Evidence 7) shows only Blackquill in the corridor at the crime time. The photo (Evidence 8) shows Blackquill with the robot that has a bloodstain. However, Ponco's testimony suggests Athena was present when Metis fell, which could conflict with Blackquill being the convicted killer. But wait, the evidence from the seven-year-old case (like the video and photo) points to Blackquill, but Ponco's testimony says Athena was there. However, maybe the contradiction is that the video (Evidence 7) shows Blackquill was the only one present, but Ponco's testimony says Athena was there. That would be a contradiction. But wait, let's check the testimonies again.

Wait, Testimony 0-5 are all from Ponco, and they refer to the incident seven years ago, right? Because in Evidence 2, the utility knife was used by Athena to stab the phantom's hand during that incident. Also, the seven-year-old video (Evidence 7) and the photo (Evidence 8) are from that time. 

So Ponco's testimony says that Athena was present when Metis fell (Testimony 1 and 3), but the video (Evidence 7) shows that only Blackquill was in the corridor at the time of the crime. But the video is of the corridor to the crime scene. If Blackquill was the only one passing through, how could Athena be there? That would be a contradiction. But perhaps the video only shows the corridor, not the actual room. Alternatively, maybe the video is considered conclusive evidence that Blackquill was the only one present, conflicting with Ponco's account of Athena being there. 

Alternatively, looking at Evidence 8: the photo shows Blackquill taking the robot apart with a bloodstain on the robot's arm. But according to Testimony 3, Metis fell near the window on the workbench side, which might be different from the photo's depiction. But I'm not sure.

Wait, let's think again. The key contradiction would be between a testimony and an evidence that directly conflict. For example, if the testimony says someone was in a place, but the evidence proves they couldn't have been.

In Testimony 1: Ponco says Athena came in and hugged Metis, then Metis fell. However, Evidence 7 (the video) shows that only Blackquill passed through the corridor at the time of the crime. If the video is supposed to show that Blackquill was the only one present, but Ponco's testimony says Athena was there, that's a contradiction. However, maybe the video doesn't cover the entire time or the entire area. Alternatively, maybe the video shows Blackquill was there, but Ponco's testimony implies Athena was also there, which could mean the video is missing something.

But according to the evidence, Evidence 7's video shows that Blackquill was the only one to pass through the corridor at the time of the crime. So if Athena was present in the room (as per Ponco's testimony), she would have had to go through the corridor. But the video shows only Blackquill. So that's a contradiction: the video (Evidence 7) contradicts Testimony 1 (Athena was there). Therefore, the evidence (7) and testimony (1) contradict each other. 

Alternatively, maybe another contradiction. Let's check Evidence 8: the photo shows Blackquill taking the robot apart with a bloodstain on the robot's arm. But if in Testimony 3, Metis fell near the window, but the autopsy report (Evidence 10) says she was stabbed in the chest. However, that's not necessarily a contradiction.

Wait, but the photo (Evidence 8) became conclusive evidence in Blackquill's trial. The photo shows Blackquill taking the robot apart, with a bloodstain on the robot's arm. But Ponco's testimony (Testimony 4) says that after recharging, she was cleaning and Simon came in. Then an error occurred (Testimony 5). So perhaps the photo (Evidence 8) shows Blackquill dismantling the robot, which would have happened after Ponco started recharging. But according to Testimony 4, after charging, Ponco was cleaning when Simon came in. Then the error occurred. If the photo shows Blackquill was there during the time Ponco was active, but Ponco's testimony says she only saw him after she finished charging, that might be a contradiction. But I'm not sure.

Alternatively, perhaps the contradiction is between Testimony 3 and Evidence 9. Testimony 3 says Metis fell near the round window on the workbench side. Evidence 9 (the seven-year-old photos) shows the victim lying on the operating table, with the workbench on the other side. If the photo shows the body on the operating table, but Ponco says Metis fell near the window on the workbench side, that's a contradiction. Because the workbench is on the opposite side from the operating table. So if Metis fell near the window (workbench side), but the photo shows the body on the operating table (the other side), that's a contradiction. Therefore, Testimony 3 and Evidence 9 would contradict each other.

Let me check Evidence 9's description: "Two photos of the body and crime scene. They were taken by the first person to discover the body. [caption] The victim is lying on the operating table. On the other side of the room is a workbench. The victim's clothes are drenched in blood." So according to the photo, the body is on the operating table, while Testimony 3 says Metis fell near the window on the workbench side. That's a contradiction because the body's location in the photo (operating table) doesn't match where Ponco said Metis fell (workbench side near the window). Therefore, Evidence 9 (photos) contradicts Testimony 3 (location of Metis's fall). 

Yes, that makes sense. So the testimony says she fell near the workbench side window, but the photo shows her on the operating table on the other side. Therefore, the pair would be Evidence 9 and Testimony 3.

cot:
Okay, let's try to figure this out. The task is to find which evidence and testimony contradict each other. The user wants only one pair, so I need to look through all the testimonies and see which one is contradicted by one of the evidences.

First, let's go through the testimonies. The key ones here are from Fulbright. Testimony 3 says that the lighter with Athena's prints proves she's the culprit. The evidence mentioned here is the Lighter (Evidence 18), which has Athena's prints in the victim's blood. But wait, Testimony 4 from Fulbright adds that the prints on the lighter are the thumb, index, and middle fingers of a right hand. Now, looking at Evidence 17, which is Aura's Statement, she mentions the perp held a lighter with an Earth emblem in their left hand and a knife in the right. 

So here's the contradiction: If the perpetrator was holding the lighter in their left hand (as per Aura's Statement), then the fingerprints on the lighter should be from the left hand. However, Fulbright's Testimony 4 says the prints are from the right hand's fingers. That doesn't match up. The evidence (Aura's Statement) suggests the lighter was held in the left hand, but the testimony claims the prints are from the right hand. Therefore, the prints on the lighter (Evidence 18) as described in Testimony 3 and 4 are conflicting with Evidence 17's description of the perp's left hand holding the lighter. 

Another point to check: The Lighter (Evidence 18) has Athena's prints in the victim's blood, but according to Aura's statement, the perp used the left hand for the lighter. If Athena is right-handed (which might be inferred if her prints are right-handed on the lighter), but the actual perp used the left hand, that would be a contradiction. Therefore, the testimony about the right-hand prints (Testimony 4) contradicts the evidence from Aura's Statement (Evidence 17) about the left hand. 

Wait, but the user's answer format requires the evidence and testimony numbers. Testimony 3 is the one where Fulbright presents the lighter as evidence against Athena, but the contradiction comes from the fact that the prints are right-handed (Testimony 4) versus the perp using the left hand (Evidence 17). So the contradiction is between Evidence 17 (Aura's Statement) and Testimony 4 (prints on the right hand). Alternatively, since Testimony 3 is about the lighter having Athena's prints, but the real contradiction is between the hand used. 

But let me double-check. Evidence 17: Aura's Statement says the perp held the lighter in the left hand. Testimony 4 says the prints are from the right hand. Therefore, if the perp used the left hand, the prints should be left hand, but the testimony says right. So the contradiction is between Testimony 4 (Fulbright's statement about right-hand prints) and Evidence 17 (Aura's statement about left hand). 

But the question is which evidence and testimony contradict each other. So Evidence 17 (Aura's Statement) and Testimony 4 (Fulbright's Testimony about the prints being right-handed) would be the pair. However, the problem is that Testimony 4 is part of Fulbright's testimonies, and the evidence is Aura's Statement. So the answer would be {"evidence": 17, "testimony": 4}. But let me check if there's a more direct contradiction elsewhere. 

Alternatively, looking at Testimony 3: Fulbright says the lighter with Athena's prints is proof. But Evidence 18 (the Lighter) has Athena's prints, but according to Aura's statement (Evidence 17), the perp was holding the lighter in the left hand. If Athena is right-handed, then the prints being right-hand would mean she held it in her right hand, conflicting with Aura's statement. But the problem here is that Evidence 17's statement about the left hand holding the lighter contradicts the testimony that the prints are from the right hand (Testimony 4). Therefore, the contradiction is between Evidence 17 and Testimony 4. 

So the correct pair should be Evidence 17 and Testimony 4. Let me confirm the numbers. Evidence 17 is Aura's Statement, Testimony 4 is Fulbright's statement about the right-hand prints. Yes. That's the contradiction. The perp's left hand holding the lighter (Evidence 17) vs. prints from the right hand (Testimony 4). Therefore, the answer should be {"evidence": 17, "testimony": 4}.

Description: Evidence found by Detective Fulbright. It has Athena's prints on it in the victim's blood. A lighter that can transform into a handgun. It has Clay Terran's fingerprints and blood on it.
Evidence 19
Name: Emergency Ladder
Description: It was lowered to the ground from the window of the fourth-floor robotics lab. It was used to evacuate Space Center personnel.
Evidence 20
Name: Phony Phanty Bomb
Description: It was found in Boarding Lounge 1 and detonated in Courtroom No. 4. Fragments are being analyzed. (2 pages.)

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: I felt fear when I thought about the moon rock because it reminded me of the phantom.
Person: Fulbright
Testimony 1
Testimony: Yes, I'm very afraid of him because he took my family hostage.
Person: Fulbright
Testimony 2
Testimony: What reason would the phantom have to be afraid of the moon rock?! None at all!
Person: Fulbright
Testimony 3
Testimony: So the very fact that I'm afraid of the moon rock means I'm not him!
Person: Fulbright
Testimony 4
Testimony: In fact, I'm on the side of... JUSTICE!
Person: Fulbright

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let's see. I need to find which evidence and testimony contradict each other. Let me start by going through the testimonies and evidences provided.

The testimonies are all from Fulbright. Let's look at each one:

Testimony 0: He felt fear about the moon rock because it reminded him of the phantom.
Testimony 1: He's afraid because the phantom took his family hostage.
Testimony 2: He argues the phantom wouldn't fear the moon rock, so since he (Fulbright) is afraid, he's not the phantom.
Testimony 3: He uses his fear of the moon rock to claim he's not the phantom.
Testimony 4: He says he's on the side of justice.

Now, the evidence. Let me check each one for connections to the moon rock or Fulbright's claims.

Looking at Evidence 12: Moon Rock Earring. It's an earring Athena got from her mother, made from a moon rock used in research. But how does that connect to Fulbright's testimonies?

Wait, Evidence 2: Utility Knife. The description mentions Fulbright saying the phantom stole the moon rock and killed Dr. Cykes. The evidence also says Athena used a similar knife to stab the phantom's hand. The notes here include Fulbright's statements about the phantom stealing the moon rock. But in his testimonies, he's claiming that the phantom wouldn't fear the moon rock, hence his own fear proves he's not the phantom.

But wait, if Fulbright is the phantom, then his fear of the moon rock would be a contradiction. According to Evidence 13: Phantom's Psych Profile, the phantom has emotions that don't fluctuate and doesn't feel like normal people. So if Fulbright is the phantom, he shouldn't feel fear towards the moon rock. However, in his testimonies (Testimony 3), he's using his fear of the moon rock to argue he's not the phantom. But if he's the phantom, that fear would be fake or impossible. But how does this tie to evidence?

Looking at Evidence 18: Lighter. It has Athena's prints in the victim's blood, but also Clay's fingerprints and blood. Wait, but maybe the key here is Evidence 13: Phantom's Psych Profile, which states the phantom doesn't experience emotions normally. So if Fulbright's testimony is about fear (emotion), which contradicts the psych profile of the phantom. However, the testimony where he claims fear (Testimony 3) is supposed to show he's not the phantom. But if there's evidence that the phantom can't feel fear, then his testimony would contradict that. However, Evidence 13 says the phantom's emotions rarely fluctuate and he doesn't feel like normal people. So if Fulbright is the phantom, he shouldn't be able to feel fear normally. Therefore, Testimony 3 where he says he's afraid of the moon rock (thus not the phantom) would contradict Evidence 13 (Phantom's Psych Profile). But wait, the user asked for evidence and testimony that contradict each other. But Evidence 13 is about the phantom's profile, so if Fulbright is the phantom, then his testimony about fear would contradict that. Alternatively, Evidence 2 mentions Fulbright's own statements about the phantom stealing the moon rock. Let me check Evidence 2's details again. Evidence 2's description includes Fulbright saying "He stole the moon rock and killed Dr. Cykes seven years ago!" and Athena recalling her mother's murder. Also, the utility knife was used by Athena to stab the phantom's hand. So if Fulbright is the phantom, then his claim in Testimony 3 that he's not the phantom because he's afraid of the moon rock would be a lie, but how does that tie to the evidence?

Wait, in Testimony 3: "So the very fact that I'm afraid of the moon rock means I'm not him!" But according to Evidence 2, Fulbright himself says that the phantom stole the moon rock. So maybe the contradiction is that Fulbright claims fear of the moon rock (Testimony 3) but if he's the phantom who stole the moon rock (as per his own statement in Evidence 2), then he shouldn't fear it. Wait, but in Evidence 2, Fulbright is the one accusing the phantom of stealing the moon rock. So if Fulbright is the phantom, then his own statement in Evidence 2 is a lie. But how does that tie to the testimony?

Alternatively, perhaps the contradiction is between Fulbright's testimony (Testimony 3) where he says he's afraid of the moon rock (thus not the phantom) and Evidence 13 (Phantom's Psych Profile) that the phantom doesn't have normal emotions. So the testimony of fear would contradict the psych profile, implying that Fulbright is lying. Therefore, the pair would be Evidence 13 and Testimony 3.

But the user wants only one pair. Alternatively, maybe Evidence 2's note includes Fulbright saying "He stole the moon rock..." which would mean that Fulbright is accusing the phantom. But if Fulbright himself is the phantom, then he's lying. But how does this contradict a testimony? Let's see.

Fulbright's Testimony 3: "So the very fact that I'm afraid of the moon rock means I'm not him!" But according to Evidence 2, Fulbright's statement is that the phantom stole the moon rock. If Fulbright is the phantom, then he did steal the moon rock. But why would he fear the moon rock if he stole it? Unless the moon rock is incriminating. But according to Testimony 3, he's using his fear as proof he's not the phantom. However, if the phantom (Fulbright) stole the moon rock, then he might not fear it. So his fear in Testimony 3 would be a lie, which contradicts his own prior statement in Evidence 2 where he implicates the phantom as the thief of the moon rock. Wait, maybe the contradiction is that in Testimony 3, Fulbright claims fear of the moon rock to prove he's not the phantom, but in Evidence 2, he states that the phantom stole the moon rock. If the moon rock is something the phantom would have, then the phantom wouldn't fear it. Therefore, Fulbright's fear (Testimony 3) would contradict the fact that the phantom stole the moon rock (from Evidence 2's note). Therefore, Evidence 2 and Testimony 3 would contradict each other. Because Fulbright is saying the phantom stole the moon rock (Evidence 2's note), but then in Testimony 3, he says he's afraid of the moon rock, which he uses to argue he's not the phantom. However, if the phantom stole the moon rock, then the phantom would be associated with it, so if Fulbright is the phantom, he might not fear it. Hence, his testimony that he's afraid of the moon rock (Testimony 3) contradicts the fact that the phantom stole the moon rock (as per his own statement in Evidence 2's note). Therefore, the contradiction is between Evidence 2 and Testimony 3. The key is that Fulbright's testimony 3 claims fear of the moon rock to distance himself from being the phantom, but his own statement in Evidence 2's note says the phantom stole the moon rock. If the phantom stole it, then the moon rock is connected to the phantom. If Fulbright is the phantom, his fear would be a lie. Hence, the contradiction arises.
